value: Plate 43, from Neüw Grotteßken Buch (New Grotesque Book)

label: Description
value: Ornamental escutcheon composed of leafy bend-work. In the center is a putto playing a lute and standing on a bush. At either side, a leaf forms with shell-like blooms.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of the Estate of David Wolfe Bishop
Plate 44 from Neüw Grotteßken Buch (New Book of Grotesques)

label: Description
value: Ornamental vase of auricular, cartilage-like form and containing plants terminating in grotesque heads and intertwined by spider webs. The base of the vine is composed of four turtle-like insects.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of the Estate of David Wolfe Bishop
Plate 46, from Neüw Grotteßken Buch (New Grotesque Book)

label: Description
value: Ornamental cartouche composed of auricular, cartilage-like forms with a winged, turbaned man with bird legs and wings for arms. Above, two fantastic beasts hold garlands, and at either side, dragons.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of the Estate of David Wolfe Bishop
Plate 48, from Neüw Grotteßken Buch (New Grotesque Book)

label: Description
value: Ornamental grotesque forms composed of auricular cartilage-like forms with a winged, turbaned man with bird legs and wings for arms. Above, two fantastic beasts hold garlands, and at either side, dragons.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of the Estate of David Wolfe Bishop
Plate 53, from Neüw Grotteßken Buch (New Grotesque Book)

label: Description
value: Ornamental motif composed of a grotesque head of an old bearded man wearing armor, from whose shoulder plates project vines and exploding canon-balls. His hat is composed of a rabbit with wings.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of the Estate of David Wolfe Bishop
Plate 55 from Neüw Grotteßken Buch (New Book of Grotesques)

label: Description
value: Two ornamental cartouches of auricular cartilage forms. The one at the left composed of human and mollusk forms; at the right, of elephant heads with feathery tufts and spiralling trunks.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of the Estate of David Wolfe Bishop

label: Description
value: Wood box with lid attached with three hinges. At front, decoration of two roses, and a keyhole. At side, a key with the mark: IP. IG. Inside is the music cylinder. Printed paper label affixed inside the lid with two brass tacks. Striped border with lyre and face. Text reads: Six Airs / Etouffoirs en acier soit a Spiraux. Listed at center are the songs: Home Sweet Home; Motif de l’Ouverture de Gustave, d’Auber; Jim Crow; Berger Galop de Strauss; Isabel; and Finale du Serment, d’Auber.

label: Credit line
value: From the collection of Mrs. Lathrop C. Harper

label: Description
value: Octagonal engraved brass disc on three feet; in center, sunk compass. On one side hinged, scrolled frame for missing pendulums. On other side, a hinged graded circle segment for setting latitudes. On third side, hinged ring with hours, and cross bar with needle. B) Octagonal case covered with brown leather and lined with blue silk. Disc with engraved named and latitudes of important cities inside cover.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper: 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Two rectangular pieces of varnished wood, hinged together with wire, and painted with discs and Chinese numerals in black and red. Compass sunk in glazed center of tower piece. Brass wire stretched between the two pieces serves as sun dial indicator.
Skippet and cover with seal of Leopold II

label: Description
value:
a) Circular box with four holes on sides for cards. On bottom, engraved shield with LII , crowned. Inside the Great Seal of the Austro-Hungarian Empire, surrounded by legends. 
b) Cover, with four indentations on sides. Top engraved with Leopold II’s arms.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: One large brass disc and one small on either side, pivoting on center nail. Top engraved: Calendarium Perpetuum” and days of the week in German, together with their symbols. Cut-out edge adjustable to date engraved on large disc. Back disc has two cut-outs, adjustable to show holidays, month, sign of zodiac, sunrise and sundown, length of days and nights.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lanthrop Colgate Harper; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Shaped purse frame and inner frame pivoting on two pins. Front piece engraved with church and townscape, birds and scrollwork. Suspension ring and diamond-cut knob.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lanthrop Colgate Harper; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Shaped purse frame with inner frame, pivoting on two pins. Engraved with scrolls and oval medallions, front and back.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Brown leather binding, tooled in gold with coat-of-arms surmounted by a crown, with curvilinear decoration (on both front and back). End papers of “Dutch gilt” with stylized flowers and fruit in brick red.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper

label: Description
value: A lady greets a gentleman who bows, hat in hand, under a spreading tree.  A small dog sits on a chair under the tree, left.

label: Physical description
value: Silver leaf, etched, and black paint on glass

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper

label: Description
value: Embroiderer shown at work in his shop, assisted by a woman. Facsimile of a page from early 16th century book.

label: Physical description
value: Black ink printed on white paper

label: Provenance
value: The Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harpor

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper

label: Description
value: Figural scene; within a partially roofed-over stable is the scene from the Nativity of the Three Magi paying homage to the Christ Child, held by the Virgin Mary at left. Figure of Joseph behind her. At right, the Magi in elaborate dress and coats present gifts of gold, frankincense, and myrrh. The interior setting and the flesh of the figures is painted in gouache, the clothing is rendered in applied cloth.

label: Physical description
value: Coth and paper, brush and gouache on cardboard

label: Provenance
value: Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper, New York, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper

label: Physical description
value: Cut black paper, cloth, pen and brown ink, metallic threads, laid down on white laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Estate of Mrs. Lathrop Colgate Harper

label: Description
value: A scene in a restaurant or inn in which five men are seated at tables, a gas fixture above illuminates the scene.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and drypoint on Japanese paper

label: Provenance
value: David Keppel, New York, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Thames River is spanned by a wooden bridge with an iron center section. At the right are a group of houses and a square church tower. The shore is seen through the arches.

label: Provenance
value: David Keppel, New York, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A night scene in a narrow village street. The buildings are bathed in brilliant moonlight, left. A lantern shines on a building, right. The plate is crossed by bisecting lines from the four corners and four parallel horizontal lines, all in dry point.

label: Physical description
value: etching and open bite or sandpaper ground on paper, canceled plate

label: Provenance
value: David Keppel, New York, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: In a rustic interior a peasant woman sits before baskets of woll, carding some in her lap. Behind her, left, is a large spinning wheel.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in brown ink on cream-colored paper

label: Description
value: A peasant woman sits near a diamond-paned window, right, sewing a shirt. Her implements rest on the window sill.

label: Physical description
value: Etching in dark brown ink on cream-colored paper

label: Description
value: Portrait of Annie, daughter of the artist Francis Seymour Hayden. She is shown, seated, facing front and looking down, with her hands folded in her lap.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and drypoint on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: David Keppel, New York, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
Sketch after Cecil Lawson's "Swan and Iris"

label: Description
value: Near an iris plant a swan flutters in a stream which flows under an arched bridge. In the distance are barges, four tall trees, a low shed and two chimneys.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and drypoint on cream laid paper

label: Provenance
value: David Keppel, New York, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Men converse on a barge, presented in the left foreground in sharp perspective. Just beyond, fishing boats line the river with their masts standing up against the sky. Through the masts, London Bridge is visible. At left, the buildings that make up the Billingsgate Market are shown with people bustling up stairs from the river. The clock tower is visible at upper left.

label: Physical description
value: Etching and drypoint on white laid paper

label: Provenance
value: David Keppel, New York, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A champagne glass stands on a small pie-crust salver.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. David Kepel, New York, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A young male figure with long hair is seated, his hands resting in his lap and his head bent to the right. Portrait of Arthur, son of the artist, Francis Seymour Haden.

label: Provenance
value: David Keppel, New York, NY; 1957: acquired by Museum
